Articles.Content:
When I put on a subassembly on x2 symmetry, take it off, press Command-Z to undo the change (so the subassembly gets put back on, but still with a floating, unattached copy in red), and then put the removed subassembly back on, the SPH becomes unresponsive. After restarting KSP and loading the plane again, the SPH is still unresponsive, so I think that this glitch corrupts the .craft file.

This is a method I used in the previous version to "copy" small subassemblies without saving them, and I know that it worked back then.

Edited December 20, 2014 by QuesoExplosivo

Yes, the Undo option seems to be a little glitchy as of late, not sure exactly what's up with that. At any rate, you can copy things much faster (and avoid this issue for the most part) by using Alt+Click (might be Command+Click, not sure exactly how the control layout goes on OSX) to copy a part or stack of parts.
